compound.name: radiant plane
description: Everything one is capable of experiencing takes place within Radiant territory. Color, sound, time, thought, and more are all executed together to form what we know as reality. Life in its entirety takes place in the Radiant Plane.

compound.name: umbral plane
description: This dimension runs adjacent to the radiant plane. All functions of reality are first calculated and executed through umbral space. Housed within, the patron hues diligently operate their respective tasks.

hues.name: umbrage
description: This hue controls the *storage* and *management* of Umbradial elements. It's most often exploited to manipulate the location or size of various things.
design: Umbrage looks like a particularly dark *shadow* with crisp edges. Shapes are formed entirely of curves and move organically.

hues.name: trifle
description: This hue actualizes *birth* and the *perseverance* of Umbradial entities. It's generally used to create, sustain, and bring back life.
design: When active, trifle seeps into the air as a heavy *smoke*. The smoke starts opaque but will dissipate fairly quickly.

hues.name: eclipse
description: This hue facilitates *death* and the *reduction* of Umbradial components. It has the potential to remove any given thing completely and irreversibly, to the point of it never existing in the first place.
design: The inner eclipse core is a complete *solid* and cannot change shape. Bordering it is a thin and seething umbral flame.

hues.name: root
description: Guides the *reading* and *discovery* of Umbradial truths. Those who employ it tend to see through illusions or obstacles. Others opt to learn information from distant places and times.
design: Root conducts almost exactly like *lightning*. Either visually striking a target or making short bursts of electric pulses.

hues.name: spire
description: This hue stirs the *perception* and *processing* of Umbradial functions. It can be applied to toy with the operative processes of thought and random chance.
design: Sources of spire will periodically spawn clumps of soapy *bubbles*. These float outwardly for a short period before popping.

hues.name: bedlam
description: This hue empowers *creativity* and the *overruling* of Umbradial traditions. Ironically, it's the hue with the most restricted use case. It is exclusively used to craft special items that when used, will grant exceptions to reality's rules.
design: In moments of inspiration, bedlam flows in splashes of viscous *paint*. Afterwards, quickly sinking into the objects it landed on.

name: delta
delta effect
delta clause
delta phenomenon
delta pressure
delta tension
delta influence
description: This hue is a supreme and absolute force over the entire Umbradial Compound. It embodies the *uncertainty* and *change yet to come* of all components. Any entity or rule, physical or conceptual, at any given time, is subject to being rewritten by delta.

regions.name: Queen's Rest
description: A vast expanse of hills and plateaus, covered in a thick carpet of clovers. An especially diverse set of wildflowers dot the area. Known for its fair weather and remnants of Old Earth, Queen's Rest is a popular site for historians and tourists alike.
Pinpointed exactly at this region's epicenter is the resting place of the *First Mother*. Presumably, an aura of lingering *trifle* is what brings so much life to the surrounding land.

regions.name: Flavoma
description: Flatlands and plains make up the majority of the region, intersected by a labyrinth of rivers and offshoot creeks. With rich soil, warm air, and frequent rain, Flavoma is the ideal place for a plantation. The climate here supports a healthy life for both its crops and its citizens.

Flavoma is the native homeland of the amphibious chimera, and they account for nearly 100% of its people. The connection is so exclusive that the words “Flavian” and “chimera” are commonly interchanged.

regions.name: Grandfather Dunes
description: Capital: Outlaw's Oasis

regions.name: The Bog
description: Capital: Bog King's Mansion

regions.name: The Edge
description: The border separating the rest of GardenGrave from the Hell crater. This landscape is barren and rocky, riddled with jagged mountains and steep cliffs. Heat from Hell below causes ashes to rise and collect in a massive cloud above. The sun is obscured, the land is perpetually dark. No vegetation can survive on the Edge. All life must be carnivorous to survive.

This place is where all the unforgivable dredges of society are banished to. Its prisoners are antisocial and arrogant. Since the murder of the original Edge Lord, the only thing ruling this land is the law of angst.

regions.name: Hell
description: A burning hot crater kilometers below ocean level. An unforgiving environment peppered with magma cracks and boiling geysers. This land is scarce for resources, so life down under is dangerous and desperate to fight for it.
Escaping persecution, early devils settled in Hell to live in peace. Since then, they've adapted to the harsh environment and created a thriving civilization.

regions.name: Piki Archipelago
description: Capital: Iki-Piki

regions.name: Blackwater Woods
description: Capital: Duke's trailer

regions.name: Frijfeld
description: Capital: Yagaren cabin

sentients.name: human
description: You should be pretty familiar with these guys. As a pre-Perforation species, humans make up the overwhelming majority of the GardenGrave's population.
Humans are seen as a species arrogant and stubborn with age. The collapse of the ancient world has given them a reputation for violence.

sentients.name: reptilian
head: structure varied based on ancestry
circular tympanic membranes
reptilian nostrils
eyes: nictitating membrane instead of traditional eyelid
tail: shape and properties vary based on ancestry
sentients.nails: small claws or none at all
description: A reptilian's scales are capable of pigment alteration. The level of control over this will vary between individuals. Historically, reptilians have used this to hide from humans.

sentients.name: umbraborn
description: Creatures of pure *umbrage*, birthed from the Perforation. Umbraborn come in vastly different shapes, though all share the commonality of their silence.
They appear to be formed from the discarded data of dead entities. Essentially, they're ghosts.

sentients.name: amphyllate
crop: plant-like growth wildly varied in properties
top and sides of head, sometimes face
lacks a nervous system, can be trimmed without harm
head: rounded, larger features
circular tympanic membranes
none
rounded
fat and forked
description: Though an amphyllate possesses traits from many different animal kingdoms, it is closest to the amphibian. Thin and permeable skin allows for dermal respiration, especially efficient in a moist environment.
A notable feature of the amphyllate is the lack of a true nose. Instead, a stubby forked tongue can be used to accurately pick up on scents.
Instead of ears, an amphyllate has barely-visible circular tympanum on each side of its head. Between them are a pair of eyes completely filled with pupils.
The most unique trait of the amphyllate is the plant-like growth sprouting from the head. The attributes of this crop vary greatly and are unique to each amphyllate.
A amphyllate has no claws or nails of any sort. This, coupled with a generally small stature, makes the amphyllate a more fragile sentient than most.

sentients.name: devil
hair: flame resistant, heat causes strands to curl
horns: two extruding from forehead just below hairline
laterally symmetrical, wild variation in shape
head: accentuated, acute features
tapered
human standard
pointed
eyes: heat resistant, iris covers most of eye
tail: rests at a slightly lower angle than horizontal
description: Unfinished text.

sentients.name: synthient
description: Unfinished text.

vikings.name: Sazha Brunikin
story: Excerpt from Boris Borson's *Tales to Bewilder*
It was unusual to see a devil in Frijfeld. I had heard they were kind, so I called out to ask her name.
Everything about her felt, wrong. The air hung stagnant. She looked old, but her skin was young. I could barely let out a whisper.
notes: Life outside of Hell has exposed Sazha to the sun, so her skin is dark and freckled. However, an abnormally mild environment has keeps it healthy and young.

Sazha is designed with four cores in mind: a patron hue(*eclipse*), animal(*reindeer*), weapon(*club*), and halloween cryptid(*devil*). She doesn't know how to fight, but may use a thick branch to defend herself if needed.

vikings.name: Halfrid Vorobevna
notes: Halfrid is designed with four cores in mind: a patron hue(*spire*), animal(*winter wolf*), weapon(*battle axe*), and halloween cryptid(*werewolf*).

vikings.name: Vali Asgerof
bio: Burdened by *angelicism*, Vali is entirely permanent. He cannot be removed from reality.

Despite his immortality, Vali's body has taken extensive damage from *frostbite*. His skin is black and extremities numb. As a result, his motor control is poor. Vali often slurs his words when he speaks.
He wears the horns and hide of *Berglót*; an old friend from a past life.
story: Years ago, a great storm circled ^Starajn Peak^. Thrashing winds loosed an avalanche, barreling towards a hunting encampment down below. Men were seized by the snow and scattered miles apart.

One hunter surfaced in an unknown plain. Looking around, all he could see was a lone woolly rhinocerous; likewise separated from its herd. The beast marched blindly through the ongoing blizzard. And with no better option, the hunter followed.

Hours passed and the creature slowed. Frozen and exhausted, it collapsed to the ground. With little hope for his own life, the hunter joined its respite. The two lied together as their bodies went numb.
notes: The way Vali's angelicism works is by constantly being reestablished. He's like an object that gets instantiated at the end of every frame. Vali can't not exist, because he's part of the core loop.
Vali is designed with four cores in mind: a patron hue(*trifle*), animal(*woolly rhinocerous*), weapon(*spear*), and halloween cryptid(*zombie*). Some of his tattoos look like a zombie's stitches.

vikings.name: Runa Yagaren
notes: Erin is designed with four cores in mind: a patron hue(*bedlam*), animal(*ravenhawk*), weapon(*shortbow*), and halloween cryptid(*witch*).

vikings.name: Casimir Helgeson
notes: Casimir's brother *Calder* is a blacksmith in ^Village Name^.
Casimir is designed with four cores in mind: a patron hue(*root*), animal(*hare*), weapon(*knife*), and halloween cryptid(*vampire*).

vikings.name: Fiske Adriknir
notes: Fiske is designed with four cores in mind: a patron hue(*umbrage*), animal(*narwhal*), weapon(*shortsword*), and halloween cryptid(*ghost*).

characters.name: Taxavasion Homicide
description: The original Edge Lord. Taxavasion established a governmental structure in the Edge through a one-man military coup. Countless attempts to dethrone him have been brutally cut down with his signature sword 'Militana'.
Techinically, Tax is an angel. An angel of umbrage. Physics seems to render his arms a little longer than they actually are.

characters.name: Solemn Harrow
description: Born a monkite, Helen was immediately sold to *the Lab* by her disappointed parents. She served as an underling for 17 years, until she had a violent psychotic break. Helen was promptly restrained, but not before snapping off the left horn of *Nightmare's Angel*.

Perhaps as a punishment for her disobedience, Helen's brain was removed and used to create a *cypher soul*. After some re-programming to prioritize athletic Bally-Ball skills, the cypher soul was put back into her head.

characters.name: Minty McCane
description: A small, unconfident Flavian. Minty in an apartment with his older sister, Pepper.
Minty represents the rhetorical appeal of *ethos*.

characters.name: Pepper McCane
description: The fun, athletic older sister of Minty McCane. She's great at making people smile, and even better at playing Bally-Ball.
Pepper represents the rhetorical appeal of *pathos*.

characters.name: Cain Spears
description: The cold, lonesome best friend of Minty McCane. He wants nothing more than to see others succeed.
Cain represents the rhetorical appeal of *logos*.

misc.name: gnome
description: The gnome is a species of *penumbral* fauna native to ~Insanity Woods~. They stand at an average of 11 cm.

They sport two short legs and a mane of white hair. Above the main is a *tentacle-like appendage* that can extend up to 2 1/2 times its resting length. Gnomes use this appendage to grab items and prey. Their diet consists mostly of berries, insects, and small fish.
Gnomes are a *microsocial* species, living in small families of 4 to 6.
